III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Development of service plans
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418 (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent
Section or parents and the foster parents in the development of service
Description plans to enable the parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the parents' and the foster
parent's role in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-agency
1

treatment plan with the parent or parents and foster parents. The
agency must inform the parent or parents and foster parent that
the information in the parent-agency treatment plan and any other
information about the child and the child's family is confidential.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Parent has not been provided with service/treatment plans.
Investigation On 2/5/25 Complainant reported to DCWL that Parent 1 had not
received copies of foster care reports for months. Complainant
also stated Parent 1’s children were taken over seas by Parent 2,
without consent from Parent 1.
Interviews:
Parent 1 was contacted by email on 2/6/25, as email was
identified as their best communication method. Parent 1 was
asked for clarification about the reports that were not received.
Specifically, if “reports” referred to Parent Agency Treatment
Plans (PATP). Parent 1 indicated they received “reports” via
email, from their lawyer. Parent 1 stated they had completed all of
their classes and did not understand why Parent 2 was able to
travel with the children. Parent 1 was asked to specify any months
that they did not receive a PATP. Parent 1 did not provide any
additional information.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via video call on 2/6/25.
Foster Care Worker reported they provided Parent 1 with copies
of all treatment plans after they were completed. Foster Care
Worker stated that treatment plans were emailed to Parent 1.
However, Parent 1 refused to sign and return some of the
treatment plans. Parent 1 also refused to meet with Foster Care
Worker over the past few months. Foster Care Worker indicated
Parent 1 was participating in services briefly, but then stopped
attending parenting classes and therapy. Services were
terminated in December 2024, due to non-participation. In July
2024 the children were court ordered to be placed with Parent 2 in
Lebanon. The placement did not occur until December 2024 due
to a delay in obtaining travel documents.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed via video call on 2/6/25.
Foster Care Supervisor reported the children were court ordered
to be placed with Parent 2 in Lebanon. Parent 1 was not
participating in reunification and was aware of this court order.
2

Documents reviewed:
MiSACWIS Case file review
• Service Plans dated 2/16/24, 5/16/24, 8/14/24, 11/12/24
had a recommendation of placement with Parent 2.
• Court order dated 7/29/24 ordered placement with Parent 2
in Lebanon. Placement occurred on 12/24/24.
• 2/16/24 PATP signed by Parent 1 2/26/24
• 5/16/24 PATP signed by Parent 1 6/25/24
• 8/14/24 PATP was not signed by Parent 1. A case contact
on 8/27/24 indicated the report was emailed to Parent 1.
• 11/12/24 PATP was not signed by Parent 1. A case contact
on 12/4/24 indicated the report was emailed to Parent 1.
• Case contacts showed FCW maintained monthly contact
with Parent 1 through phone calls, email and text.
• Email dated 1/7/25 from Child Welfare Therapeutic
Services-Parent Education indicated Parent 1 was non-
compliant with services and completed 1 of 14 sessions.
Analysis The agency was found in compliance, as there was insufficient
information to support the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
